Package org.aeonbits.owner

Class ConfigFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.aeonbits.owner.ConfigFactory

  • public final class ConfigFactory
extends Object
    A static factory class to instantiate Config instances.

    By default a Config sub-interface is associated to a property having the same package name and class name as the interface itself.

    Method names are mapped to property names contained in the property files.

    This is a singleton static class, to be used as convenience when only a single factory is needed inside an application. It exposes the newInstance() method to create new instances of Factory objects.

    Author:
    Luigi R. Viggiano

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static Factory newInstance​()
        Returns a new instance of a config Factory object.
        Returns:
        a new instance of a config Factory object.

      • create

        public static <T extends Config> T create​(Class<? extends T> clazz,
                                          Map<?,?>... imports)
        Creates a Config instance from the specified interface
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the interface.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the interface extending from Config that you want to instantiate.
        imports - additional variables to be used to resolve the properties.
        Returns:
        an object implementing the given interface, which maps methods to property values.

      • setProperty

        public static String setProperty​(String key,
                                 String value)
        Set a property in the ConfigFactory. Those properties will be used to expand variables specified in the `@Source` annotation, or by the ConfigFactory to configure its own behavior.
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the property.
        value - the value for the property.
        Returns:
        the old value.
        Since:
        1.0.4

      • clearProperty

        public static String clearProperty​(String key)
        Clears the value for the property having the given key. This means, that the given property is removed.
        Parameters:
        key - the key for the property to remove.
        Returns:
        the old value for the given key, or null if the property was not set.
        Since:
        1.0.4

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • setTypeConverter

        public static void setTypeConverter​(Class<?> type,
                                    Class<? extends Converter<?>> converter)
        Sets a converter for the given type. Setting a converter via this method will override any default converters but not Config.ConverterClass annotations.
        Parameters:
        type - the type for which to set a converter.
        converter - the converter class to use for the specified type.
        Since:
        1.0.10
